q: Howard Stern calls Jay Leno a "crook" in interview Piers Morgan Tonight, the shock jock calls the NBC late-night host "insane" and accuses him of stealing sketch ideas. Jay Leno is a crook and the world knows exactly what he's up to. He steals a tremendous amount of material, The New York Post quoted Howard Stern as saying. "This guy's ripped off like 10 major things from my show." Howard Stern also adds he's baffled that Jay Leno has beaten fellow late-night host David Letterman

Also taken were pieces from the Amarnah period, including a sandstone head of a princess and a limestone statue of Akhenaten holding an offering table, Zahi Hawass said in an emailed statement. An investigation has begun, to search for the people who have taken these objects, and the police and army plan to follow up with the criminals already in custody, the statement said. Zahi Hawass said earlier that thieves had broken in through the roof of the museum on January 28 at the height of clashes between police and protesters who eventually toppled President Hosni Mubarak last week.

that seemed to holler to all their doubters, "Take that!" "We just wanted to show the whole world we could play together," Carmelo Anthony said after the duo's triumphant debut Monday night. We know there's a lot of doubt about that. Carmelo Anthony scored 28 points in his return from a 15-game suspension for fighting and Allen Iverson added 23 in the Denver Nuggets' 115-98 rout of the Memphis Grizzlies. The two are out to prove two superstars can coexist.
